newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Escudo retreats before strong mark.
newsitem.headline: Escudo retreats before strong mark.

text.p: The escudo fell back against a generally strong mark, opening at 100.58/61 to the German currency, compared with a close at 100.24/29 on Thursday.
Traders saw 100.60 as providing solid resistance because beyond that the Bank of Portugal could step in to brake the fall.
After touching 100.74, the currency was recovering to around 100.56/59, although it was not clear whether the Bank had stepped in.
Some traders said the rebound was triggered by profit-taking.
